Name: David D
Title: A large and famous gurudwara in Delhi.
Review: This is where one of the Sikh gurus spent time helping the poor and needy during epidemics and food shortages. It is sacred to the Sikhs and now many pilgrims come to pay their respects, and to walk in the waters that flow through the site. As with all gurudwaras, this one provides free food to all who ask for it, and it is said that over thirty thousand people eat here daily. The gurudwara also provides medical care to those who need it. For those who visit, they should remember to be respectful and to not take pictures inside the durbar hall, as well as having all men cover their heads with one of the free head coverings provided.

Name: Andrew Jackson
Title: Biggg heart
Review: Even after going there, it doesn't feel like we have reached here, it looks more beautiful in the evening, the light around and the gold shining from the lake, it looks like a dream, this place is a symbol of peace, tranquility and community. , cleanliness is also taken special care here, it is also true that people who come here pray for their well-being

Name: Dilraj K
Title: Heavenly feeling
Review: Heaven on earth. The peace you find sitting there is just cant described in words. One must go there and spend some time citing inside and listen to Shabad/ kirtan

Name: cheapbaazaar
Title: awsome
Review: Superb, because there are some vibes that I can not tell you in my words. Even there are places where everyone sits together for langer and water.

Name: PK SINGLA
Title: Quality
Review: My two grandsons went there last month to see and eat Langer sahib. They went from gurgaon by metro. We had instructed to put some donations too.But they said Roti was very dry.

Name: dr ganapathi bhat
Title: " Not to be missed"
Review: Any major Gurudwara in India comes across as a disciplined and calm place sans beggars and trouble mongers. Gurudwara sahib is no exception. It's a huge property teeming with devotees. One need not walk an appreciable distance to gain entry into the darbar which is the main worship hall. The darshan takes a few minutes, no pushing or pulling. Down, the beautiful area filled with the holy pond or sarovar  is a sight for the sore eyes. Can't miss the delicious  prasad or Kada Prasad. There is no entry fee, plan to stay for at least two hours, you'll love the place. Best to visit in the night. One has to cover the head with a scarf. Cameras and phone can be carried but one is not allowed to click photos, though the rule is not strictly enforced.  Footwears need to be deposited at designated places. People are helpful, a sense of bonhomie pervades the entire place. A must visit in Delhi.

Name: Hospitality Plus
Title: Hospitality plus provide a platform for our readers to get daily news about Pakistan. All updates of Hotel management, T
Review: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib ( listen) is one of the most prominent Sikh gurdwaras, or Sikh house of worship, in Delhi, India, and known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan, as well as the holy pond inside its complex, known as the "Sarovar."

Name: singhasam
Title: A very unusual experience
Review: RELIGIONS vary across the world, but when I went to what was one of Delhi's most prominent places of Sikh worship I really had to concentrate.For a start, there were nearly 70,000 people in the site.Secondly, while I was used to taking my shoes off to visit various sites across India, I had never been asked to take my socks off as well as covering my hair.It was no big deal.....until I came to the large tray of water in which I was supposed to step to purify my feet.I am well aware of the opposing significance of feet and head in different religions, but I am still Western and religion wasn't uppermost in  my mind when I dutifully stepped into the water tray at the entrance.Instead all I could focus on was how the water had been turned into a sort of soup by the passage of tens of thousands of feet before me. I hope Sikh people respect my concerns the same way I respected their religion.Once through this mental obstacle I had a few other things to occupy my mind including how I could ever take my next step.The place was absolutely rammed, packed with worshippers, many of whom took advantage of the incredible amount of free meals being benevolently dispensed at the kitchen area which did brisk business.In some places it was so packed you were almost carried forward in a dense crowd of people keen to do everything from stroll round the central holy pond to buying religious souvenirs.The smell of sweat and the press of bodies did create a feeling of claustrophobia at times, but I shook it off because I needed to keep track of my guide. There were so many people there that I lost him three times.Finally I completed my visit and went and collected my socks and trainers only to meet an official interested in explaining Sikh religion to me.I listened and even took away a leaflet which allows me to tell you that the word "Sikh" means "disciple", a person who believes in one god and the teachings of the Ten Gurus enshrined in the Guru Granth Sahib, the Sikh Holy Book.We chatted for a while and then I followed my guide out of the site to reach a different state of mental enlightenment, one where I didn't feel as much of the overpowering presence of religious fervour as I had in the temple.Definitely an experience I will not forget, but if you go to this temple be prepared for a demanding experience.A side issue is that no photography is allowed in the main areas.

Name: Akshay P
Title: Beautiful religious place
Review: We were looking forward to this visit and it was really a great experienceEverything is so well managed and the entire area is kept very cleanAlthough there was a large crowd, it was managed really wellThe access is good, ample parking is available and you will not be pestered by guides here. You will left to your own which is the way it should be at any place of worship

Name: Travellertohelp
Title: Speechless by hospitality
Review: This Sikh temple and the people inside of this premises are the best ones I've ever met. They are great to please their hospitality and the amount of food they made every single day is unimaginable.

Name: Marc R
Title: Peaceful but hot floor
Review: No one attempted to scam me here which was breathe of fresh air, very calm and peaceful. Floor was very hot midday, burned my feet but worth it. Strict rules, cover head using a scarf from the scarf bin, no hats or shorts. I did try to carry my shoes around because i was fearful after my Jama Masjid experience but a nice man politely told me to please use the communal space for shoes and i did at of respect.

Name: Jaspreet Singh
Title: Deg Teg Fateh
Review: A place for worship GOD A place to eat with everyone regardless of castes rich poor, a place to rest for traveler Waheguru

Name: Kpssethi
Title: Sikh religious temple
Review: Its a surreal experience visiting and hearing sikh religious hymns all the time. Located in central Delhi, it’s very close to connaught place. Free community kitchen and sweet meat(prasad) for everyone . Keep your head covered and feet bare to show respect.Also care for the religious sentiments while inside main temple.

Name: M_uk989
Title: Calm And Peace
Review: This holy place is calm and peaceful. It has huge free of cost parking space for both cars and bikes. Shoe holders are provided to keep the shoes safely with token. The staff is also supportive and well mannered. Photography is not allowed but yes u can take little photos if u want. The food at langer is also delicious and fresh. The environment is also cool and have huge reservoir of holy water with lots of beautiful fishes. And you can take bath in the holy water.

Name: Simranpreet Aulakh
Title: Waheguru
Review: Always a pleasure to visit bangla sahib gurudwara. All positivity around and great management. Langar hall are clean and well organised.

Name: Kohli-House
Title: Never miss when in Delhi
Review: Lot of positive vibes. Avoid going on days when there is lot of rush. You miss the peace and sanctity.  It is historical worship place in Delhi

Name: She1988
Title: More than my expectation
Review: Yesterday I went to Connaught place and one of my friends suggested me to go to bangala sahib gurudwara, after visiting this shik shrine it has changed my perception about Sikh religion, I must appreciate about the system that their guru have developed, SEVA is the asset in this religion, I got so mesmerized by the fact how they are feeding thousands of people every day for free, plus it doesn't matter how reach or poor you are, you get to sit and enjoy your food with them, plus there are people who collects your shoes and by the time you are back they polish it too. It's very neat and clean, and the colorful fish in pond looks amazing. It's highly recommended from my side.

Name: Travefit
Title: Amazing experience
Review: Best place to visit in Cannaught Place. It is opened 24 *7 . You will be delicious prasasd . People here are very nice and I have been here 7-8 times.

Name: Kiran
Title: Nice
Review: It is very beautiful tourism place. The place is so calm and peaceful. There also a beautiful pond where you have see many beautiful colourful fishes. Everyone working there are so very humble. Must visit.

Name: FoodTravelWander(FTW)
Title: Magical ❤️
Review: Gurudwara means Gate of the Teacher who shows the path of our spiritual journey  so that we can self realize ourself in this world  What we are here for. I visit bangla sahib in new year in january or feb  as its a ritual for me. People who seek peace or refuge both are welcomed. They help the sevadars of this place by cooking with them or helping them. Serving food to sangat in langar is another way. You feel blissed and at peace .Its near to sardar patel metro station and also you can take a free service to gurudwara or a paid auto or taxi.Do visit and feel the magic of the place.its even more beautiful in the night.

Name: Pooja
Title: Serene and calming!
Review: Amidst hustle bustle of the Capital..this place gives one the desired solitude and strength to face another day! Guru Vani is soul calming and  the kada prasad is delicious as ever! There is langar all day. There is a Sikh history museum in the Gurudwara premises.  One can donate ration for langar and sit by the sarovar to feel the divine vibes! There is a clinic for all who need medical help. Wahe Guruji da Khalsa..Wahe Guruji di fateh..

Name: Legend H
Title: Most beautiful Temple in delhi
Review: Sikh temple middle of central part of delhi Always the best place to go and get the blessings of waheguruji. Every visit it bring out all the dormat feelings and make me proud of being a Sikh, most amazing part of this place is free kitchen lovely experience.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Must visit, if you are in Delhi
Review: This must be on your list, if you are visiting Delhi for sightseeing. Very near to Connaught place. Very nice architecture.

Name: Gurpreet Singh
Title: Blissful place at the heart of Delhi
Review: Blisful place at the heart of delhi. This place is blessed by the 8-th sikh guru guru harikrishan sahib ji. This was actually a bangla of the raja jai sigh where guru sahib poured the charnaamrit in the well. People took the jal from this well and got free from the disease. till today people have same belief and take jal from that well. Langar, rooms available. Huge sarovar is also there.

Name: Rotem B
Title: Must to be visit
Review: Very beautiful place, with very pleasant peoples.you can take photos only outside. in the temple it's not aloud to take photos at all in in the kitchen and dining place just not selfie.they're very kind and one person took me around and explained about the religion.the music inside is inspiring and relaxing.they don't charge anything. you may donate

Name: Arshpreet K
Title: Memorable
Review: It's indeed an excellent Gurudwara to visit and know the history of gurdwara. Its very big complex having a big pond inside. A big kitchen where thousands of people are getting  food daily. Excellent.

Name: Anonymous
Title: Hostility towards taking photos even outside gurudwara
Review: The place is surely nice and recommended. But what I find troublesome is the hostility displayed either by the guards or some self imposed guardians regarding taking photos outside the premises. Sure one respects the place and does not take photos inside the gurdwara. But if somebody wants to have couple of picture near the lake or a selfie with gurudwara as the backdrop, I think none should have a problem with it ! One is following all the rules, covering our heads, removing the shoes, respecting the place in general. On a special occasion I had gone with my gf and as a memoir was taking a selfie to be reminiscent of the day.. some uncle from behind started shouting you taking photos go and pay chalan ! Mind you it was outside the gurudwara building.. there should be some logic in not allowing.. there are already 1000s of picture on internet including filmed from dscr.. why those allowed then ??

Name: Priya Singh
Title: One of the best Place Bangla Sahib in Delhi
Review: I leave in Noida NCR last 4 years so I visit Bangla Sahib. So I like Bangla Sahib because it is a beautiful and peaceful place in Delhi NCR. It nearby CP just within walking distance. Here everyone follows covid19 rules and very clean and hygienic. I book the Chiku cab for sightseeing.

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Wonderful place
Review: I visited Gurudwara Bangla Sahib on 13th Feb 21.The place is wonderfully well managed. There are foot operated taps for washing your hands, well managed footwear deposit store, good parking, neat and clean premises and lots more.Gurudwara is open all the times. After darshan, you can spend sometime near big sarovar with beatiful fishes inside. The prasad is served to all at the exit and can additionally be taken on the counters by taking a slip.

Name: MashruJeet
Title: Must visit in Delhi
Review: This is a very beautiful and peaceful Gurudwara located near Connaught Place, New Delhi. The Gurudwara has an amazing ambience, and you can even sit there for sometime to enjoy the songs. It also has a holy pond. The Gurudwara discourages people from taking selfies and encourages them to be in the present.

Name: Where_to_travel_next
Title: Sikh House of workship
Review: Biggest sikh temple in Delhi.  My favour part of the tour was being able to watch and help make roti and eat dal (lentil curry). This was precovid-19.

Name: beyondtravel
Title: Guruji ke darbar
Review: Historically a palace, which is now a shrine and guru dwara best known for its belief and serenity. Located in heart of delhi, is a must visit place.

Name: Rahul G
Title: Bangla sahib
Review: Very peaceful and comfortable ambience. A line of devotees but everything is well manged. A must visit for people of sikh religion to come to this place. At the center or the heart of Delhi.

Name: FreeIndianBird
Title: Delhi's Most important place to visit
Review: Have visited Gurudwara Bangla Sahib in this covid situation with my mother. At the entrance body sanitization process you have to go through the gates who sprinkles sanitizer for safety. And important thing is as of now gurudwara is not providing any clothes for to cover your head so better to carry scarf or dupatta from your home else you can buy a piece of cloth from shops nearby gurudwara.They are providing Halwa Prasad but langar is not active now. In the sitting area you have to follow social distancing , you can listen gurubani and  spend time. It is a place where i feel that everything is good and peace. If you have been to amritsar Golden Temple gurudwara than you will feel it gives same impression.

Name: Mukul Aggarwal
Title: Amazing & Mesmerizing Experience
Review: It was indeed a beautiful visit, just loved the atmosphere out there. Would definitely love to visit here again.

Name: Kulbir5676
Title: Best place for peace
Review: This place gives you the positivity and peace of mind.  Love to visits again and again, langer food is awesome, ace is also very neat and clean. Every one should visit once

Name: Sans K
Title: Visit to Bangla sahb
Review: Gurdwara 's everywhere give you a sigh of relief strength and positivity and that so in Delhi.Bangla sahb is one of the renown gurdwara's among India it is very beautiful .Kadha prasad offered here is very tasty and here a langar hall so that all gets a meal.

Name: suman
Title: A place where you wanna come again
Review: I went to This place again and again during my college times. This place has the magnetic aura which gives you postivity and  peace. I really liked the beauty of it. The langar is really tasty and for that i can wait for hours also. I am happy that this place is so nearby to my college(hardly 10 mins) which made my graduation memorable with my friends.

Name: travelnomadNZ
Title: Must Do when visiting Delhi
Review: What an amazing place. My first time ever in a Sikh temple. Highly recommend you take a tour. Everything is ornate. Completed to a high standard. It's essential you have a guide to see this complex.Hint : a guide is required to get the best of your visit. Women wear temple clothing. A headscarf was provided for most of us. Camera and warm clothing in December. There will be areas you are not allowed to film - ask.

Name: doctorritu
Title: Always a good experience
Review: A beautiful place. If you want to get some peace of mind visit gurudwara bangla sahib, preferably at dusk or at dawn.. It beautiful at that time. You can offer your prayings, listen to ardaas and even do Seva ( service) at gurudwara kitchen or shoe place. Bangla sahib runs very big langar seva and feeds thousands of people everyday. You can eat parshadi and langar after prayer.Must visit place if you're a religious person

Name: Mohit behl
Title: A peaceful place
Review: A very peaceful place u guys feel relaxed n calm . They help alot of people in the time of lockdown worst situations seriously,  A big Salute too all of them who support them from heart ,

Name: Ays Espiritu
Title: Interesting
Review: It is one of the stops in our New Delhi trip and it was very interesting!We first entered a building, which seems to be only for tourists. The rooms got AC and there are also toilets. We were told to leave our shoes in a drawer as we have to be barefoot all over the area. We were also given orange headscarves which we need to wear while inside the temple premises. I suggest to bring your own headscarf for hygienic purposes!Our guide showed us first the kitchen where we saw volunteers help in peeling, cutting and slicing the vegetables. We also saw a lot of people sitting patiently and calmly waiting for their turn to enter the dining area for the free meal that is distributed in the temple. We were told that everybody is welcome to eat and volunteer to help in the kitchen. The food are also donated by people.The kitchen is big and got huge pots and utensils. It was impressive! You can also help make the bread. You also have to be barefoot while in the kitchen. Be careful as it can be slippery and sticky.You are also allowed to enter the temple while everybody is praying. It is really interesting! By the temple, there is also a big pool where people bathe. You can also see some fish in it.It was a sunny day and the whole place is so bright because the temple is painted white and gold. Sunglasses may be good to have while there.

Name: dhen
Title: Unique
Review: Visited on a Road Scholar tour so we were able to learn the historical background and how the Temple fed thousands of people each day. Got to walk through the food preparation area and see the huge hall in which people were fed. Impressed with spiritual concerns that places such as this show to the people of India. The "story" is more impressive than the photo opportunities the temple offers. Not a "must see" but worth the time once you get there.

Name: Meander With Mer
Title: A beautiful temple with so much to offer visitors and worshipers
Review: I was genuinely surprised at how much I took away from this visit.  While personally not overly religious person I can see why worshipers and visitor alike come to see the temple.  Beyond the beauty and the religious meaning the simple fact that the all volunteer kitchen makes and serves 40,000 meals a day is amazing to me.  I am a big fan of the architecture and this place does not disappoint.  The domes, the arches, the sacred lake and reflections....simply beautiful.Be prepared to remove your shoes and cover your head, they offer coverings and a place to store your shoes.

Name: Pranav Garg
Title: Peaceful
Review: Bgla sahib is religious place which so beautiful and spiritual. It will definitely give you inner peace. They offers Langar to evryone and one can gave that delicious meal. Also the Halwa prasad is a blessing.

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: BEAUTIFUL SIKH TEMPLE
Review: Gurudwara Bangla sahib is a beautiful sikh temple with golden domes.It is situated in central Delhi near Cannaught place.It is very quite and calm place.It is a religious temple with historical importance.This gurudwara commemorates the visit of eighth guru shri Harkrishan sahib ji to Delhi in 1664.Photography is not allowed here.A free langer is organized here everyday.Parking and entry is also free.Head must be covered during the visit of this gurudwara.

Name: wanderor1986
Title: amazing spiritual experience
Review: gurudwara bangla sahib is very popular place of worship. free food for everyone is available anytime inside the gurudwara.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Dedicated to the eighth guru
Review: The gurudwara commemorates the visit of eight guru Shri Guru Harkrishnan Sahib Ji to Delhi in 1664. You need to cover your head while entering the sanctum. There is a sacred lake nearby. Also on the premises is a small museum.

Name: Skeney57
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: This Sikh Temple dominates the local area and is a constant source of people streaming into the Temple & grounds. With heads covered we respectfully wandered through with the faithful.The sacred lake is for Sikhs only and was a focal point for their visit. With the Museum, feeding Hall & other points of interest , it is a great Delhi stop.

Name: naveen siromoni
Title: Delhi's best Gurudwara
Review: Located at the heart of the city its well connectedMetro station closest is Shivaji stadium on the airport express line but you can use the Rajiv Chowlk one too. Bus services are plenty from all areas in Delhi and its located near the Pahar Gung are which houses budget hotels.What strikes you first is the way its organised. A very user friendly place. All systems are in place be it security or services like the langar and the prayer path. People are extremely humble and helpful. There are very good stores on the premises to get any thing you want for your religious needs. Not to mention the best food stalls outside.Its spotlessly clean and there is a place to keep your footwear safely.The tranquility of the place is striking despite the hoards of people visiting the place. Covering your head with a scarf is a must so you can pick one up at the entrance from one of the colorful stalls.Avoid going there between 12 to 3pm in summer as the marble floor is hot even though there are carpets along the path.its a spectacular place and the architecture is unmatched. In fact recently they have added two blocks which are very modern in services but have maintained the traditional feel.

Name: Smokey128
Title: Inspirational
Review: A beautiful Sikh temple with golden onion domes and a sacred lake. The rhythmic chanting of the Sikhs makes it a truly spiritual place to wander. You are not allowed to take photos so when we were given permission by a couple of the guards we took the gap, but then no selfies were allowed. The kitchens of this temple feed thousands every day- a meal of dahl, lentils, rice and roti. The huge kitchen with its gigantic copper pots being stored are a sight to behold

Name: Ramesh
Title: Visited with friends and family. Actually our family friend was leaving for Abu Dhabi and insisted for a visit before le
Review: It was about 9PM when we visited. Right from entering a serene atmosphere prevailed.As we walked to the main temple we encountered people offering tea and food and queue of people to receive the same. We first deposited our footwear at neatly administered place and a token was given to us.As further walked we washed our feet in flowing warm water and took a special headwear available to cover our heads. We had easy darshan of Granth Sahib with folded hands and chanted the usual words and returned to our home.

Name: Parwani K
Title: Gurudwara bangla saheb in top 10 visiting places in Delhi
Review: Very calm, quiet place to connect with God. Very beautiful religious place with historical importance. Taking picture is not allowed here. I visited at night time had langar as well.

Name: Charu
Title: Find your Soul here
Review: Calm and quiet place, sit besides the sarovar and find yourself, Try to go for kirtan too you will really like it.

Name: Rahul Babbar
Title: Worship has power to calm the body and remove stress.
Review: Very interesting and most liked place for me. When I am free I must visit this for internal peace. Also good place for family and friends also. First enter then submit you shoes and cover your head with cloth. After that buy prasad if you want and go inside for worship. You can stay there if you want to listen spiritual songs. After that came at pond you can take rest there with your family or friends. And enjoy the beautiful view. After there is free langar(food) that is must because this is started first by guru nanak dev ji who said naam japo te wand chhako means make believe in God and eat food with sharing with all.After there is a meausim you can take a tour of this. You'll get headphones and when you go near any painting or anything there is information about that is automatically playing in your head phones.At last there is a 3d show. There is no fee for all this things.you can spend whole day there.This is amazing place. Must visit.

Name: MAYANK
Title: SOUL & PEACE
Review: The place where you can find peace! The place where you can find yourself! One of the places where the crowd would not bother you in any way! You will lost in your own happy world once you enter that soulful place!

Name: Ricki
Title: One of the big size gurudwara in Capital of India Delhi
Review: Popular Gurudwara in Capital City Delhi. Gurudwara Bangla Sahib. Located in Central Delhi nearby Connaught place. Biggest in size,

Name: Pooja Saha
Title: Peace!
Review: If you're in Delhi, you must visit Bangla Sahib once. I find so peace here! You can spend hours peaceful. Don't forget to take the prasad which is heavenly good.

Name: nathan0008
Title: An oasis of tranquility
Review: Located not far from Connaught Place, this temple is very welcoming to tourists. There is a specific room for shoes and headscarves for visitors and also information on the religion. The temple itself is built in a traditional style and the singing is very soulful. Do sit and enjoy it before proceeding to the pool.

Name: Dashers2014
Title: This site was a real eye opener!!
Review: Large area. Free car park. Free entry. Very clean and serene. A place to keep your footwear manned by volunteers. Massive crowds but all going around in beautiful order following instructions that are given with kindness and love by the many hundred of volunteers. Water and prasad provided for free. Lovely music being sung by a group of men and women.The best thing for me was this religion about which I knew and still know very little treats men, women and children the same!

Name: Vivienne M
Title: A must-see in Delhi!
Review: A stunning Sikh Temple just a short walk from Connaught Place. We spent around 1 1/2 hours here walking around. The people  there were very friendly. Open to non-Sikhs. Well worth a visit.

Name: Ilovemyjollies
Title: Lovely experience
Review: What a lovely experience to come here and see the importance of religion to the Indian people.It's free to go, and I felt very spiritual being part of it.We were told you can get free food here but we didn't see where it was. Highly recommend

Name: manoj ......
Title: Wow
Review: A chance to visit a Sikhs temple that regularly  feeds over 10000 a day for free. The volunteers  that work for hours to feed the hungry  with no requirement  needed  to eat there .

Name: Nell
Title: A great communal experience
Review: We aren’t religious but were welcomed warmly to attend the prayers and communal dinner afterwards. A great experience in a beautiful setting. All people there were friendly and let us know what we needed to do but there was also a tourist information centre. You need to have your head covered but they have bandanas there is you don’t have a scarf: I’d recommend this to anyone visiting New Delhi.

Name: Manish N
Title: Calm haven must visit
Review: Beautiful  gurdwara in delhi .easy walk from cannought place or paharganj .open to all visitors  for non Sikhs it is a bea6 place to visit to experience  the peace and beauty  of a Sikhs temple

Name: ghummiwithnandini
Title: My kind of place
Review: I likr gurudwaras that one is special , the one thing I like is the halwa prasad that's my favourite , you also do seva after that you will feel good.

Name: jonathan p
Title: Eye opening
Review: I know nothing of the Sikh faith but will now learn more. The guide helped me to put the headscarf on and then we quickly toured through. What a buzz ! Beautiful music, peaceful disciples,  25000 free meals prepared and served by volunteers daily.

Name: amyAtlantaGA
Title: Amazing experience
Review: The Gurudwara is a beautiful site. The most impressive part was to witness the kitchen that serves anyone who wants food. We were able to walk through the kitchen to see the community who come together to serve the community.

Name: Daisy_from_Oz
Title: Something special
Review: Our visit to the Gurudwara Bangla Sahib early in the morning was one of the highlights of our visit to Delhi.  The atmosphere in and around the temple is calm and peaceful and the most beautiful singing and praying is piped around the complex.  We removed our shoes and donned scarves to comply with the entry requirements and wandered around, exploring the temple, the sacred pond, the dining hall and the kitchens where the mammoth task of preparing meals for the thousands of visitors is conducted.  I was given the opportunity to work with the volunteers preparing roti and it was a very special experience.  The Sikhs are warm and welcoming and the memory of our visit holds a special place in my heart.

Name: sujatasingh2222
Title: Most prominent Gurudwara
Review: One of the most prominent Sikh Gurudwara (house or worship) the holly river inside it's complex known as Sarovar.Nearest metro station is Rajiv Chowk, gate number 7, then auto rikshaw for Bangla Sahib(on Baba Kharak Singh Marg)Jo bole so nihal sat sri akal

Name: RicherTrips
Title: An impressive community work
Review: In case you arrive by car, it has a modern parking lot. You’ll have to remove shoes and socks and walk on a stream to wash your feet; and the floor was really cold in January. In the tourist center they give abayas for ladies and handkerchiefs for both to cover the head; I wore my scarf, but had to wear the abaya although I was wearing a tunic style blouse. Pictures are not allowed in the temple but you can take them at the entrance and in the Langar. It’s impressive to visit this huge kitchens when they’re working, and witness all the pilgrims and visitors being fed, regardless of their religion. The temple is not the finest architecture, but the ensemble withe the Sarovar or sacred pool and the Langar are an important visit.

Name: Wen-D K
Title: A Holy site of generosity and spirit
Review: Due to. Fluke in our schedule, this was a surprise add on that quickly became one of the highlights of our entire stay in India. The fact that this temple welcomes everyone, irregardless of religion, cast or nationality and feeds more than 10,000 people a day through the generosity of volunteer workers - well...it was just an amazing sight to see. A true spiritual Mecca.

Name: Sandip Patel
Title: Tranquility at its best
Review: If you want peace of mind & offbeat from hustle bustle of Delhi this is a place come sit feel the silence and positive vibes do Seva have langar its a experience one must do when in Delhi

Name: Gidons51
Title: Very special very interesting , don’t miss !
Review: This is a beautiful temple of the Sikhs , which is a secret religion .The most interesting part is the free feeding dining hall that feeds 20000 people every day . You can go into the huge kitchen and see how they prepare the food , cook , bake pita bread etc . Go to see the big water pool which is sacred and believed to fulfill your wishes . Take shoes off and wear a scarf on your head as the Sikhs do .

Name: Vanshika Chandna
Title: Regular visit
Review: Visited with my cousins and their kids to have a peaceful time and taking blessings. This place is having some really positive vibes and is so beautiful and clean. Must visit 😇

Name: Quilterwannabe
Title: Humanity at its best!
Review: Of course it is a fascinating place to sightsee, but mind boggling to see the food operation to feed any and all who come, numbering in the thousands daily.  It is serene and compassionate and uplifting.  It was also interesting to hear the beliefs and practices of the religion.

Name: dilawar
Title: Every body must visit this place
Review: Everything is so nice here we have visit this place many times  shanti millti hai yahaa just visit at listen the kirtan

Name: Umesh G
Title: Chaliya at Gurudwara
Review: It is one of the most sacred place. A very peaceful place. I with my wife goes daily for past few months.

Name: SanjayKapoor
Title: Must do if in Delhi
Review: Culturally this is a must do if you are in Delhi. Just a very nice, serene temple to visit. If you know the history behind it it’s even better. Very spiritual.

Name: DDL1972
Title: Crowded
Review: You need to remove your shoes and socks.  It is not allowed to enter with yours shoes in the bag with.  You should left them at  tourists for information office.

Name: Angad Singh
Title: Calm Haven. Must visit for Sikhs
Review: Beautiful gurdwara in Delhi. Easy walk from Connaught Place or Paharganj. Open to all visitors. For non-sikhs it is a beautiful place to visit to experience the peace and beauty of a Sikh temple. Be sure to cover your head (there are coverings provided if you forget one). Visit the gurdwara temple, walk around the sarovar (water) and take prasaad (blessed sweet) and enjoy Langar (free meal)  A must visit for Sikhs in Delhi.

Name: Inderpal S
Title: Soul satisfaction
Review: The Gurdwara is a place of worship for Sikh community like church for Christians. The Banla sahib is centrally located in delhi and historical gurdwara. The amrit serve in it believe to cure many diseases. It has pond of water.The Langer serve all 365 days for any one who is hungry without discremating any caste,color ,creed or religionThe God name is sung by singers all the time and lot of devotees visit place throughout the day

Name: Michael L
Title: A must visit if in New Delhi
Review: A chance to visit a Sikh temple that regularly feeds over 10,000 a day for free. The volunteers that work for hours to feed the hungry with no requirements needed to eat there is amazing.

Name: Mehru B
Title: Beautiful place to visit
Review: One of the nicest and cleanest places in Delhi. Truly worth a visit. Please carry a head scarf as you must cover your head when you go inside.

Name: Stephany A
Title: observe generosity
Review: We toured this temple on a particularly busy Sunday.  It was quite crowded but on the oupside was truly amazing to see such generosity.  This sikh temple serves hundreds of thousands of free meals every day.  It doesn't matter what your background is, they serve everybody.  We had a tour of the kitchen where volunteers are cooking vats of dal, rice, and chapati.  I felt like I didn't have enough time here to see the beautiful holy pool and would like to learn more about this place.  I would definitely go back.  Good to know before you go: you must cover your head (scarfs provided) and walk barefoot inside (shoe storage is free).

Name: Ralph
Title: Temple
Review: Our guide took us to this place. Very quite and peaceful place. Yummy dessert given when you leave the place

Name: mconnoisseur
Title: Peace
Review: This is a place where you can have the blessings as well the peace . The thing that matters is it is open for all people irrespective of the religion and it is open 24*7

Name: puneet0310
Title: Peaceful
Review: This place is peaceful.  On several occasion, it is not crowded. The langar was good. we reached here by metro (Patel Chowk and Rajeev Chowk metro station is nearby).

Name: SSDNY
Title: Sikh Temple
Review: Temple in the hustle and bustle of capital city of India. Visit to Sikh temple always give you peace of mind and put the priorities in perspective.

Name: HuntleyNewYork
Title: Inspiring and Wonderful
Review: This really is a must visit in Delhi. The temple is beautiful, fascinating, and the food kitchen alone will renew your faith in the generosity and goodness that can exist in the world, regardless of your religious views.

Name: Only_the_two_of_us
Title: We can learn a lot here!!
Review: Visited here as part of our tour of new Delhi  and despite having freezing cold feet walking around barefoot in December  it was such an experience. Not only do you learn about the Sikh religion but to see the people working in the kitchen - voluntarily- and to learn that the kitchen is open for food 24/ 7    365 days a year for anyone  who is hungry  is a lesson that we could all learn from. A beautiful  building, well looked after and such a peaceful and humbling experience.

Name: Barbaraendo
Title: Must seen place!
Review: This is an Sikh temple, pretty beautiful. You must to take your shoes off and keep your hair covered (men and women) to go inside. I really recommend you to wear your own scarf in your hair, but there are the shared ones too. Tip: the place is amazing to watch the sunset!

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Pious atmosphere
Review: Easy access by public transport. Pious atmosphere for meditation and prayers. Divine ambience. Must visit.

Name: Connie D
Title: Incredible Beautiful Place!
Review: This building and these people are absolutely amazing! We were able to have a private tour and also help in making bread for the thousands that come to eat everyday.This world could learn a lot from this place on how they give back to people who have nothing.

Name: vasudevamunish
Title: Connect with supreme power
Review: A visit here is the time to connect with the supreme. Positive vibrations all around with a prayer atmosphere makes you believe in the blessings. The kadha Prasad is really delicious

Name: UKAghada
Title: Holy & Divine Place.
Review: Good morning friends. Greetings for the day. Before visiting India Gate we decided to visit this holy & spiritual place of Sikhs.    Very peaceful & spiritual experience for us. It is very organized & systematic arrangements there for entering & exiting the place. Separate lines for ladies & gentlemen, inside there is a large pool known as a "Sarovar". It is very unique & memorable experience for me. Thanks for reading my review.

Name: Divyjeetsingh
Title: Gurudwara Darshan
Review: I can't describe my feeling's for Gurudwara sahib and I think no one in this world and this place is favorite for all the Delhi and is heartbeat of Delhi

Name: ind68
Title: Religious visit
Review: Most clean and well managed religious place I have ever visited in all over India although very crowded but very peaceful ,must visit place for everyone

Name: Rishi Tayal
Title: 1st day of year😍😍
Review: New year celebrations in gurudwara is favorite 😻They have hot water available for the visitors to wash the foots here Thanks for this👏

Name: Dave C
Title: My favorite site in India
Review: Toured the site and the kitchens where they prepare free meals for the public. Felt a deep spiritual connection to this site, even as a non-member visitor from the USA. I loved reading a bout the Sikh principles and commandments. Removing shoes and wearing head cover I felt added to the experience and made it feel special. I think about it still days after visiting Delhi.
